'Sulfasalazine' (brand name 'Azulfidine' in the U.S., 'Salazopyrin' and
'Sulazine' in Europe and Hong Kong) was developed in the 1950s
specifically to treat rheumatoid arthritis. It was believed at the time that
bacterial infections were the cause of rheumatoid arthritis. Sulfasalazine is a
sulfa drug, (a derivative of mesalazine) and is formed by combining
sulfapyridine and salicylate with an azo bond. It may be abbreviated 'SSZ'.
